comments:
I am trying to visualize objects in a treeviewer. I have to reset the input, 
because the root as well the children have changed, when the refresh is invoked.
Doing that, I get StackOverflowErrors sporadicly. I have not figured out, when 
or even the reason, that is causing this. Sometimes, i can refresh 10 times, 
sometimes not even once with the thrown error. The thing is, it does throw the 
error, but displays everything correctly. Unfortunately the treeviewer looses 
focus, does not expand and the error log shows up with the caught throwable.

here's the stacktrace:

Thanx for consideration!

How deep is the tree?  Can you provide some JFace code for us to debug?  I'm 
moving this to Platform UI because the original problem was reported against 
JFace.  Please move back to SWT if the problem is in SWT.

Is the same item in the tree twice? If so then we don't support this currently
(we hope to in 3.2) and your content provider might be building the same tree
all of the time.

This could happen sporadically as we create the items as required - if the
repeated node is not visible then you won't get it

The same SWT TreeItem cannot be in the tree twice (or at least, I'd be amazed 
to see code that could do this).  Don't know about JFace.

The tree only goes down to level 3.
Also I do not have double usages of tree items. However, I seem to have created 
a memory leak in the very top root.
I was using a private Field, that has not been assigned before usage. So I 
guess, when the instance of the object, holding this Field, was created, the 
reserved memory for the field was filled with some pointer, that was causing 
the stack overflow. This could explain the sporadic popup of the throwable.
At least the error has not shown up anymore. (so far)
Does this seem reasonable?
If so, it wasn't a bug, but my stupidity.
If the bug has gone away, suggest we close the report as WORKSFORME.
